You don't get as much leg space as you would get with British Airways but for a 2 hours flight is absolutely fine. Seats needed some attention but overall appearance was good. No concerns over aircraft safety anyhow. Cabin crew was polite and helpful aircrew kept updated regularly (more than other major carriers do). Overall as usual very satisfied with Easyjet.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","easyJet customer review","","","D S Caine","(United Kingdom)","17th April 2013","My wife and I recently went on holiday to Malta booking the flights and extra length seats online through EasyJet. This coupled with the rapid check-in and boarding was completely hassle free with the flight time out and return being on time. All the staff throughout were efficient and courteous making our holiday experience relaxing enjoyable and stress free.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","easyJet customer review","","","P Munro","(United Kingdom)","16th April 2013","London Gatwick to Edinburgh International and back on the same day. Generally ok flight from Gatwick to Edinburgh was late by 3 minutes however the flight back was delayed 30 minutes. However staff were helpful and friendly in getting information to passengers. Despite having little leg room the seats were comfortable and fine for a short flight. Food was ok. I gave a zero for Inflight Entertainment because there was none. The price was fantastic at least £20 cheaper than British Airways (on an equivalent flight). In general a good experience. don't expect them to be on time or to be as good as the more pricier companies but for a short flight (anything less than 3 hours) you really can't go wrong.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","easyJet customer review","","","S Redfern","(United Kingdom)","16th April 2013","LGW to Marrakech return on A320. Both flights arrived on time. Service was reasonable as you get what you pay. Newish aircraft's.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","easyJet customer review","","","David Chown","(Spain)","16th April 2013","Malaga to LGW LGW to Nice return. On time on all 4 flights no problems with the flight. The problem is the airports. At Malaga we were sent down the ramp and then had to wait about 10 minutes while the previous passengers disembarked. We were right behind large glass panels and the sun was baking! No way to shelter. At LGW Easyjet has a sort of add-on terminal which is at least 400 yards along endless corridors from the exit into the main terminal. It carries the numbers from 100 upward and most North Terminal Easyjet flights use it. For anyone who finds walking less than pleasant it is a long way!","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"9","easyJet customer review","","","H Gibbs","(Netherlands)","16th April 2013","I fly regularly between Amsterdam and Luton. Except during ash clouds and extreme weather the flights were punctual. Pity about the extra charge for credit card payment. Only train tickets to London via first capitol connect for sale in the plane pity as people are not aware that if they get in the wrong train they will have to pay again. Also other destinations eg Bedford not for sale in cabin. A shuttlebus to the railway station don't forget to buy your ticket for this in advance! Only plane tickets bought far in advance can be had for a reasonable price at the last minute very expensive. However this is a good airline if you are travelling to the Luton area London or using the railway service from Parkway. Overall I am a satisfied customer and would recommend easyjet.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"9","easyJet customer review","","","D Jones","(United Kingdom)","16th April 2013","LIS-EDI 13/04/13. Easyjet now offer broad range of destinations from Edinburgh and will happily use them again.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","easyJet customer review","","","L Hall","(United States)","16th April 2013","After reading previous posts was pleasantly surprised. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","easyJet customer review","","","M Cowell","(United Kingdom)","11th April 2013","LGW-VCE PSA-LGW. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","easyJet customer review","","","E Birman","(United Kingdom)","11th April 2013","LTN-CDG a short flight and my first with Easyjet in almost 10 years. Price was competitive with British Airways flights to ORY and a good 30% cheaper than CDG flights.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"9","easyJet customer review","","","Mohammed Gother","(United Kingdom)","4th April 2013","MAN - Antalya - MAN. The only issue was that in Antalya you are still required to have a standard boarding card so you still have to queue at check-in. Overall for a budget airline they were very good.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","easyJet customer review","","","Richard Bickel","(United States)","2nd April 2013","Dead on-time out of CDG to Marrakech the same on return. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","easyJet customer review","","","P Le Vicount","(United Kingdom)","1st April 2013","LGW-RAK-RAK-LGW. Both flights departed on time despite poor weather in the UK. Not as in your face selling onboard as Ryanair do so no complaints. Crew were efficient and got the job done and got plenty of information from the flight deck en route. For what we paid I really cannot fault them if you follow the rules 99% time all will be ok.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"9","easyJet customer review","","","Nick Serpell","(United Kingdom)","28th March 2013","MAN-TFS return. Comfortable flight on a fairly new Airbus 320. Paid extra for exit row seats as this was a 4 hour flight and that gave us the option of Speedy Boarding. However not so important now that easyJet have started offering pre-assigned seats which removes the scrum. Speedy Boarding does mean you can drop your bag at a special Speedy Boarding desk rather than queue with the majority of passengers. This saved quite a bit of time at both ends. We had checked in online and the airline's website suggests you just turn up and drop your hold baggage. However Easy Jet's definition of ""bag drop"" sees the same lengthy queues at desks that you would get if you were checking in at the airport. Seats were comfortable with the extra legroom that goes with exit seats. Cabin crew efficient and friendly. The food offering is perfectly adequate for the length of journey. Plenty of information from the flight crew. Bit too much use of the PA system by the cabin crew. Altogether I find easyJet perfectly adequate for short haul flights.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/easyjet/page/9/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","easyJet customer review","","","S Jones","(United Kingdom)","18th March 2013","I've flown EasyJet from Bristol-Nice Nice-Paris and Bristol-Geneva (and the corresponding return journeys). Food is reasonably priced and tasty. They are always the first carrier i check when looking for flights.","","","","","","","","Cabin Flown

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""flight with AirAsia was a good one""","","","D Tan","(Singapore)","27th May 2018","✅ Trip Verified | My flight with AirAsia was from Singapore to Penang. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""love to fly AirAsia again""","","","K Gendran","(Indonesia)","18th May 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Surabaya to Kuala Lumpur. As what I am expected from AirAsia low-cost airlines, decent service and flight are always present in the whole experience. The time of flight departure is quite accurate. One of the hassle is the flight is getting strict with their 7kg cabin baggage rule. The seat is quite comfy, in comparison with other low-cost airlines. The interior is more vibrant compare to the others. I experienced no turbulence, as what I remember during the flight. Overall, would love to fly with AirAsia again.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""I end up with normal seat""","","","D Lansson","(Hong Kong)","17th May 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Hong Kong to Phuket. I booked the premium flex ticket to get good leg room. I was advised that this type of ticket allowed me to change my flight date at an extra charge. I needed to change my flight date more than a month before flight date. I tried for days to access my booking on Airasia homepage and when the page finally allowed me to login (I had correct login credentials, the page just didnt work for days) it said I had no booking. Finally I had to call their customer service to have the flight changed instead. At customer support I explained that I needed to change my flight and was told that I had to sit on a standard seat. I asked if it could be solved. They didnt even try to have it sold but just said no. I end up with normal seat instead. I then asked for a refund since I was no longer getting what I paid for. Instead I was asked to pay 1500HKD extra for the change of the flight. I had known about this rule before, but I still asked for compensation due to not getting what I paid for. Also I later found out that if I had booked a new ticket instead of using my return ticket the cost of the new ticket would have been 1700HKD. That is 200HKD more than the fee I had to pay for changing my return ticket, but still several hundred HKD less than what I paid in upgrade for the premium flex ticket I had originally purchased.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","""could not ask for more""","","","Adam Wang","(United Kingdom)","14th May 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Kuala Lumpur to Yangon. Flight on time, cabin crew friendly, pre-ordered meal arrived on time and hot, additional purchase prices for beverages are reasonable, pilots are informative, and your seats can recline on this budget airline in the newest aircraft. The fare is also very competitive. I could not ask for more. The only downside is KLIA2, low cost airport which is a shame, but this is not airline's fault.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""check to see if baggage is included""","","","J Lee","(United States)","4th May 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Siem Reap to Taipei via Kuala Lumpur. Always check to see if baggage is included. I checked in for my flight online and did not see any information about baggage. I assumed since I was flying international maybe they would not charge for baggage. I am very aware that they are a budget airline but I did not see a place to purchase baggage while checking in or I would have. I think you must have to pay for baggage when you purchase your ticket. The baggage cost me $80 USD, it was only 11kg. The cabin service was just fine.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","AirAsia customer review","5 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Rafael Suarez","(United States)","23rd April 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Jakarta to Denpasar. First time to Bali and bought these tickets on this airline based on price, did not really do any research before hand. The service on this airline was fine, I really had no complaints, the flight left on time, the seats were fine for the short flight that it was and the employees at check in and in the airplane were very nice. My only complaint is that due to my age and bad legs, boarding was done having to go down steps from the terminal to the tarmac and then up the stairs to the airplane. Similar situation upon arriving in Denpasar. Not the end of the world, just that those behind me had to suffer with my lack of speed down and up the stairs.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""pay for beverage or snack""","","","Annalisa Ard","(Thailand)","21st April 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Chiang Mai to Bali via Kuala Lumpur. We needed to pay close to 4,000 baht just to check in our bag (weighing 23 kg). When we got on the flight the seats were so close together. They expect you to pay for any sort of beverage or snack during the flight- this includes water. On the way back, we decided to try to skip the hidden baggage fees and pay for it online, only we couldn't. Every time we tried to do so, we were met with the warning that their site was experiencing a 'glitch' and that we had to do this at the airport.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Chiang Mai to Bali via Kuala Lumpur

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""I enjoyed my flight""","","","John Curtain","(Australia)","18th April 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Kuala Lumpur to Sandakan. I enjoyed my flight. Check in, given KLIA 2 is such a hectic airport, was not too bad. The flight was quite punctual as well. The prepaid food I ordered was quite tasty. Much better in fact then Jetstar. The staff were efficient and helpful as well.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""no space for your legs""","","","Vanessa Orengo","(Australia)","12th April 2018","✅ Trip Verified | On board you don't get a meal unless you buy it before hand or on board but they will refuse to serve you a glass of water. On the first occasion I have been lucky enough to get a glass of hot water, on the second attempt I have been asked to buy a bottle, but unless you have MYR with you or a credit card you won't be able to get any water. PA s never stop, On one flight i have counted 25 that drive you crazy, trying to get you to buy any sort of things. You can just notice how they save and make money looking at the aircraft: one of them on the inside was covered with advertisements even on the table and the hand luggage compartment. Emergency doors they have two rows of seats on the immediate left and right of them, the so called 'vip seats' where for an extra 20 dollars you have extra leg space. If you are unlucky to seat on row 11 in front of them, your seat will not recline and if you are tall 1.90m like my husband and someone reclines the seat in front of you, you have no space for your legs.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""this is a bus with wings""","","","P Johnson","(United States)","5th April 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Don’t recommend. Originally flight from Jakarta to Singapore was canceled and we were rebooked 5 hours later. Multiple calls to support went unanswered. No response after two days to email ticket created through their support website. No response on Twitter. Service desk at CGK was vacant. Let the ads on the carry-on overhead bins be a signal: this is a bus with wings, so expect all the qualities of a bus company, not an airline.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""didn't get any vegetarian food""","","","W Sunil","(India)","4th April 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Bali to Mumbai. My flight supposed to depart at 03.10pm, on 31 March. They allowed passengers to check in at 11.00 am but didn't inform them about the delay. Once the immigration process was completed, then they changed departure time to 07.00pm. Now passengers don't have any option other than waiting. There wasn't any AirAsia executive present at the gate. We also didn't get any vegetarian food at Bali Airport. The airline provided food as it was delayed, but they ordered Non-Vegetarian food only. They should have some common sense that Non-Vegetarian people can eat Vegetarian food, but Vegetarian people cannot eat Non-Vegetarian food. Most of the co passengers were absolutely frustrated. They promised us that they would provide Vegetarian food on the flight. But when flight departed they told us that you have to buy it. I really will not recommend this AirAsia to anyone. While going to Bali from Mumbai, one flight attendant told me that currency exchange rate with AirAsia is different. Generally 1 INR = 210 IDR(app). But with Air Asia, 1 INR = 100 IDR. That was so pathetic. I wanted to choose twin seats while web checkin. The Customer support misguided me. They told me there wasn't any twin seats available in flight so I ended up booking different seats paying equal amount. And actually twin seats were there. This airline is bearable for those whose height is less than 165 Centimeters and a journey of max 3 hours. I will not travel via Air Asia again even if they provide me free tickets. I will not target the inflight entertainment and seating comfort as it is a low cost carrier. We should not expect more from it. It is just a plane which have seats with little cushion onto it. It take off from source and lands at destination. That's all. I hope this review will be valuable for all future travelers.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft
Bali to Mumbai via Kaula Lumpur

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""save a little money but waste time""","","","S Han","(United Arab Emirates)","2nd April 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Kuala Lumpur to Bali. My flight supposed to arrive at 23:45, on 31 march they changed it to 12:55am on 1 April and offer a chance to change my flight time within the same date. So I called the customer support and moved it to 10:45am, which took me almost 45 minutes to finish the phone call. It wouldn't bother me until they told me my flight would delay to 14:35 on 30 March. I called to confirm and they told my flight was still the same time. As soon as I arrived KUL airport, I found my flight delayed to 14:35, then I asked them to move my flight to the 12:00 one, they refused my ask cause I didn't change it 48 hours ago according their policy. They changed my flight within 48 hours and ask me to make a change before 48 hours?! The woman in the counter was unwilling to face the sentences stated in the email that If the new flight is inconvenient to you, please contact our Customer Support for either one of the following options: 1. Change your flight to another time/date within 14 calendar days from the original departure date or rquest for a credit account of the value of your booking which is to be redeemed within 90 calendar days from the issuance date for your future travel with us or equest for a full refund of the value of your booking. She said she can call her supervisor but the answer would still be the same. After the call, she said although my supervisor still not agree, I can change your flight. So booking airasia can save a little money but waste time.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/IMG_5592-50x50.png","","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/IMG_5592-500x500.png","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/IMG_5592-500x500.png","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""classic point A to point B service""","","","Michael Watkins","(Australia)","1st April 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Not even a greeting getting on the plane? First time reviewer. The plethora of reviews surrounding this airline do not lie. To save time, let me first list the positives of my flights and then the problem areas. Positives: No delays. Flight arrivals were timely. Unloading was fast. Wifi was available for free. Problems: No staff acknowledgement getting on the plane to any passengers. Did not have Malaysian currency (coming from Vietnam) and was not allowed to pay by credit card so that I could have a bottle of water! Cue tip in the seat pocket from previous flight. Decor is most budget I have seen, carpet does not cover the whole floor of the plane and the stains/tears in the leather seating is obvious. Staff (not all) lacked a positive attitude toward the passengers. The rest is what you would expect from a budget airline i.e. tight, uncomfortable seating, no in-flight entertainment, no complimentary food/beverages, complimentary wifi was limited, no power supply, etc. This is a classic point A to point B service, which was delivered. However, there is budget flying and then there is Air Asia budget flying. Do not recommend.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""re-schedule without prior notice""","","","D Lee","(Singapore)","20th March 2018","✅ Trip Verified | AirAsia re-schedule my flight in April from Luang Pabrang to Singapore via Kuala Lumpur without prior notice. I try to contact AirAsia for a solution, there is no Singapore contact number. I have to use the e-form to contact them. The response from the Customer Service cannot solve my problem because I cannot accept the new flight schedule. I have requested AirAsia customer service to compensate me for cancelling my tour and my outbound flight because I have to cancel my trip to Luang Pabrang due to Air Asia re-scheduling my in-bound flight. The Customer Service Officer told me she cannot assist me because there is no such policy. I ask to speak to her supervisor and she told me she cannot transfer the call.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Luang Pabrang to Singapore via Kuala Lumpur

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""budget ticket is quite expensive""","","","Krystal Khaw","(Malaysia)","14th March 2018","✅ Trip Verified | My flight timing was changed from 2PM to 8.45AM for 1st of April for Surabaya to Kuala Lumpur. I was given the option for a full refund if the timing is not right. However I contacted them for the full refund and they never got back to me. I have been frantically trying to contact them via calls, emails, live chat, twitter, facebook since March 1. None of these methods work. There was no reply whatsoever from their customer service. I've tried calling every one of their physical office but none of the numbers work. There is no way to contact them at all. Seat and aircraft dirty and magazine is never complete. Their budget ticket is quite expensive.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""very poorly run airline""","","","Lawson Cole","(Australia)","13th March 2018","✅ Trip Verified | In short an incompetent and very poorly run airline. We caught 4 different flights with air Asia and only 1 ran on time. Delay after delay, said were boarding was at 10.20pm to still not being boarded at 11.15. Booked all my travel with my partner, requested to be seated together. When checking in not sitting together so I had to fork out $100 to choose new seats to sit together, after doing that on our last flight back to Sydney we find out AirAsia have moved our seats again and we are not sitting together. Disgustingly poor form.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Penang to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""computer allocated seats""","2 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Richard Kirby","(Singapore)","13th March 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Kota Kinabalu to Singapore. I arrived at check in 3 hours before the flight and proceeded to check in. At check in my wife was questioned as she was traveling on a Russian passport and even though we live in Singapore and provided evidence the staff still had a long discussion in Malay about whether to check her in. Eventually they did and they gave us our boarding passes. I asked if we were all sat together and the check in agent clearly said yes. It wasn't until we got to immigration and i was asked to show our boarding passes when i saw they had my 2 year old daughter sat in a different row to my wife and I. This was very frustrating as it also happened on my flight from Singapore to Kota Kinabalu where the check in staff told me i had to pay them if we wanted to sit together. I challenged the way the seats were allocated in Singapore to be told that it wasnt anything to do with them it was a computer who allocated seats. Clearly the computer doesn't have a family or doesn't want to sit with its family if it ever travels. The staff were not helpful at all in Singapore, it was only when i got onto the plane and spoke to the cabin crew did we find staff who were helpful and then helped us sort out seats together. On the flight from Kota Kinabalu to Singapore i had to speak to the gate agent who helped us find seats together. I dont understand why Air Asia cause families problems at check in when they can clearly accommodate seats together. Why add extra anxiety and why cause cabin crew or gate staff more problems because the check in staff cant be bothered to help customers? Low cost airlines splitting up families so they can earn extra revenue is being investigated in the UK and the US Senate has stopped airlines splitting families.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""downtime of their website""","","","Jamil Dybwad","(Norway)","11th March 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Have not be able to register luggage due to downtime of their website. Has taken some weeks to register because of lacking password-updates and similar faults. Wrote e-mail to customer service to change to a later flight and add luggage, since web-site does not work - no answer in over 24 hours. Travel-date is 48 hours after my request, so I have purchased tickets with another airline. In KL there is full immigration, security check and customs at arrival and the same extensive checks on departure - so transit is a few hours hard work. I am 1.80 cm, too much for the allotted space. If you sit at the window, it is difficult to get in contact with the personnel.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""making it with 5 minutes to spare""","","","Daniel Boxshall","(United Kingdom)","6th March 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Flew AirAsia from Kuala Lumpur to Manila. The check process at KLIA2 is crazy even if you arrive 2 hours early it's not possible to check into your flight without it being stressful. They require all sorts of crazy info. Automated check in doesn't work. Ended up making it with 5 minutes to spare. I'd arrived at the airport 3 hours earlier. If I'd missed it I guarantee no refund.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/IMG_20180304_084550-1-50x50.jpg","","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/IMG_20180304_084550-1-500x500.jpg","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/IMG_20180304_084550-1-500x500.jpg","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"9","""so helpful towards me""","","","Sue Lynn Tiong","(Malaysia)","5th March 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Kota Kinabalu to Kuala Lumpur. I have to commend A*****n for being so helpful towards me for this flight. Service from the AirAsia crew have generally been mediocre in the past but A*****n showed me a different side of the airline — compassion and attentiveness. She assisted me when there was an issue with my boarding pass, going till the extent of walking me to the right person in charge to get things sorted. Thanks A*****n , for changing my perception about AirAsia in general. I hope more of their staff can be as helpful as you.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""customer service and support is zero""","","","J Irving","(India)","3rd March 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Flew from Delhi to Srinagar. AirAsia has always been my least preferred airline. Again I regret travelling by this airline. The customer service and support is zero. I needed to take a medicine and asked for water by pressing the Assistance button above our seat. The air hostess came and asked me what I needed, I said water. Then very conveniently she forgot that. I mean do they teach them the meaning of that button? Very unfortunate that such a big name has such poor quality service. Thank you for giving me another reason as to why I am definitely not going to travel AirAsia again.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""their price was unbeatable""","1 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Giorgi Mosulishvili","(Georgia)","27th February 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Kuala Lumpur to Langkawi. When I was planning the trip to Langkawi, AirAsia offered the cheapest tickets. So the price was the main factor while choosing AirAsia and I must say it was really good value for money. I checked in online and everything was really easy. At the airport we had to wait about 15 minutes in the queue for the bag drop, but that was totally normal. Boarding process was well-organised. The staff on-board was very kind and helpful. The legroom was quite short for me, but as the flight took only one hour, it was easily bearable. In conclusion, it was really good decision to take AirAsia for such a short flight, as their price was unbeatable and they offer really good variety of services for additional cost, which are very convenient.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""the flight was fine""","","","Shaharuddin Mohd Sham","(Malaysia)","20th February 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Surabaya to Kuala Lumpur. he plane left the boarding gate 5 minutes behind schedule and took off 17 minutes later. Take off was smooth and the flight was fine all the way to KUL, except for a few minor bumps along the way.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""had to pay the check-in fee""","","","T Jertansson","(China)","19th February 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Puerto Princesa to Manila. We have now been flying with this airline 3 times, and two of these times we had delays for around 1 hour. When flying back from Puerto Princesa we were asked to check in what had been our carry on baggage going here. The bags weights were less than 10 kilos, soft, full of clothes, and size is according to normal standards for airlines and our previous flights with air Asia. When we asked for the reason they told its due to safety reason. So we had to pay the check-in fee and board.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""it was quite satisfactory""","","","H Leare","(United States)","16th February 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Yogyakarta to Kuala Lumpur. First time with AirAsia and it was quite satisfactory. Waited in line for about 20 minutes at Jogja to check in, but the line moved fairly quickly. My hand luggage was over 7kg so I bought extra baggage allowance, but the ground staff at Jogja never weighed my hand luggage. Boarding started at departure time so we got off the group 30 minutes late, but we arrived on time at KUL. Crew was attentive. Seats were reasonably comfortable. Announcements were frequent and easy to understand. Overall I was satisfied with this AirAsia flight.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""pre-order meal with reasonable price""","","","Agus Salim","(Indonesia)","14th February 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Yogyakarta to Jakarta. Everything is okay, the legroom may be limited for people with height more 175 cm. If you want more spacious legroom buy emergency seat. Free baggage 15 kg for Indonesia domestic flight. Overall okay, especially as they have various pre-order meal with reasonable price (same with fast food price).","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/IMG_20180119_153838-50x50.jpg

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""I had a renewed passport""","2 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","N Vashara","(United Kingdom)","12th February 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Ho Chin Minh City to Kuala Lumpur. Bad to worse from the start because I had a renewed passport (even though I showed them the old passport). On the return leg from KUL to SGN, whilst boarding I was pulled out of line, both the old and new passports taken off me (which I eventually demanded back). The staff checking boarding passes was suspicious of anyone handing her a smartphone boarding pass. What's the point of using the AirAsia App if we get dirty looks when using it for storing boarding passes? Anyway, her supervisor contacted his supervisor using WhatsApp then after sending pictures of my passports to him, I was finally allowed to board. After boarding, the flight attendants serving food want to see your boarding pass, which means if you have it on your phone (and you are sat at a window seat) you have to pass it to be inspected.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Ho Chin Minh City to Kuala Lumpur

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""fine for the price if everything works""","1 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","E Bermin","(Germany)","1st February 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Kuala Lumput to Denpasar. Our flight was delayed due to late arrival of the aircraft and ATC tech issues. AirAsia informed us about the first delay on 11:30pm the day before our 7:45am flight, while this could have happened faster I was still able to adapt to it. After boarding we waited an other 60 min with very sparse information about why, roughly in the middle of wait we were informed that there are problems with ATC and at some point later we pushed back without further announcements. The seats were fine but had little comfort. No IFE or WIFI available. AirAsia is fine for the price if everything works, if you have a problem you have a big one. Our return flight was rescheduled and offered to refund or rebook. I tried to rebook. To me the saving on airfare is not worth the very real possibility that you will spend a lot of energy and time being stressed by AirAsia messing up.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""every flight was delayed""","","","Gavin Willetts","(United Kingdom)","1st February 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Kuala Lumpur to Phuket delayed arrival of 45 minutes. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""not very comfortable""","","","S Edwards","(Australia)","30th January 2018","✅ Trip Verified | The new seats were very small and not very comfortable. The old seats for the old A320-200 were a bit bigger and a bit more comfortable. For some reason the day I flew was a very nice day to fly but for some reason the turbulence was very extreme, the pilot had to cancel the distribution of meals because of it which I believe was not turbulence, it was the pilot using the plane on manual instead of using the autopilot. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","""Staff were friendly""","","","M Davids","(Malaysia)","23rd January 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Flew Kota Bharu to Kuala Lumpur. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""prepared to be refused to board""","","","Amina Ali","(United Kingdom)","15th January 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Singapore to Bali. Have taken many flights with Airasia which have been largely positive. My last experience I arrived late (20 minutes before departure) and was prepared to be refused to board the plane. I was surprised to have to pay 3X my original fare to buy a later flight. I could have made my original flight had I been allowed to proceed without issue initially as I had no baggage to check in etc. Extremely disappointed.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""Worst flight experience""","","","L Kapin","(Netherlands)","8th January 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Vientiane to Kuala Lumpur via Bangkok. Worst flight experience I ever had. The only reason I went to the check in counter at my first leg of the flight was to see whether I was correctly checked-in since I booked through a 3rd operator. Showed my boarding pass on my phone, that was all fine, and then they gave me a paper boarding pass. While boarding, I showed my boarding pass on my phone, as I had put my paper boarding pass away, they acted like I was from another world having a boarding pass on my phone. They took me out of line, saying paper boarding pass all taking my pasport out of my hands. Then at my stopover, I couldn't transfer like I normally would on connecting flights, because my boarding pass had to be verified. Really inconvenient to say the least, almost missed my connecting flight because of it.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Vientiane to Kuala Lumpur via Bangkok

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""all went smoothly""","","","Pamila Adikari","(Sri Lanka)","5th January 2018","✅ Trip Verified | Colombo to Kuala Lumpur. We booked 6 months before and we got a very good price lower than many others. True that you need to pre-book your meals and baggage allowance. But all went smoothly. The quality of their service is very satisfactory! However selling food and Duty free items on board is bit unprofessional.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG_20171221_094921-50x50.jpg

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""refused to let me board""","1 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Tawseef Khan","(Bangladesh)","3rd January 2018","✅ Trip Verified | I bought tickets for Kuala Lumpur to Penang return. The money I had paid for the flight was wasted and I was forced to purchase another one way ticket to KL from the airport with Malindo Air. I could understand if it was an international flight, but the fact that they refused to allow me to board with 30 minutes remaining is unacceptable.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"4","""Worst customer service ever""","","","P Praveen","(India)","27th December 2017","✅ Trip Verified | Flew Kochi to Hyderabad. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""cancelled due to Bali volcano""","","","K Tan","(Singapore)","21st December 2017","✅ Trip Verified | Flight was cancelled due to the Bali volcano situation. My flight was several days after the 1st sign of eruption, no updates were provided on the potential cancellation. I was notified a few hours prior to the departure. No proper communication on how to seek refunds. I had to do my own research to find out how to get the refund. After I made the submission, I had to contact them more than 4 times in the past 21 days with no updates. On 3 out of the 4 occasions, the customer service staff I chatted to ended the conversation abruptly without a conclusion. To hang up while someone is talking is very unprofessional. Their website couldn't find my refund status record too. During the Bali volcano eruption period, Jetstar offered their affected customers an alternative flight to another Jetstar destination. AirAsia was silent throughout this period.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""never fly with them again""","","","Jaike Page","(Australia)","20th December 2017","✅ Trip Verified | Phnom Penh to Kuala Lumpur. I have no words to express my severe disappointment in this airline and will never fly with them again. They have no concept of customer service, experience or satisfaction.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""I still have no refund""","","","Jaike Page","(Australia)","20th December 2017","✅ Trip Verified | Perth to Denpasar Bali booked for 2nd December. Waited on hold the day before flight was cancelled to be told your flight tomorrow will depart as scheduled. Needless to say flight didn't go anywhere. I asked air Asia on the phone if there was any way that I could fly from my original departure city (Perth) - to anywhere in Asia within two weeks - was told no that is not possible by the most useless manager. Offered to change my flight to some time within 28 days to Bali (original route). After arguing for a refund for over two hours, I was offered no refund. Two days later AirAsia release a statement that they're going to offer everyone who bought tickets for this flight full refunds. 17 days, 3 emails, 3 phone calls, 2 Facebook conversations later, and several failed attempts to use the down for maintenance Air Asia app and website, I still have no refund.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","AirAsia customer review","","","S Wen","(Singapore)","29th November 2017","✅ Trip Verified | Singapore to Bangkok. My luggage was damaged. Counter at the airport was closed as there were no more flights from AirAsia. Wasted an hour on the phone trying to contact their customer service and received forms to fill up for the to even begin processing my request. The hoops you have to jump though in order to get a token refund from this airline is appalling. I found out that they have removed their review feature from their Facebook page.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""our luggage didn't arrive""","","","S Veener","(United States)","28th November 2017","✅ Trip Verified | We were travelling from Krabi to Jakarta, via Bangkok and when we arrived to Jakarta our luggage didn't arrive. We reported it lost at the CBTO office, they told us our bag was left behind in Bangkok and that they were going to send it back to Jakarta the next day at 3pm. We were flying back to the US next day so we couldn't claim it. It has been already 3 days since they got our luggage at CGK airport and they haven't done anything to get it back to us. We've been calling them many times and they either don't answer their calls or when they answer they hang up on us or they require us to provide a report ID number from the airline we flew back home so they can handover the bag to them. But, it's not that other airline's fault and because they don't have my luggage they can't give us a report ID number. It's not our fault, it should be the airline's responsibility to send the luggage to us. It has been a nightmare trying to get them send our luggage. Very inefficient staff in Jakarta. They don't respond to our emails and don't say anything about what they'll do with the luggage.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"5","""second unpleasant experience""","","","G Xie","(China)","20th November 2017","✅ Trip Verified | Bangkok to Chiang Mai. After boarded it was announced we need to get off and take another plane. This is the second time I have used AirAsia and a second unpleasant experience with them. First time was getting charged $140 for my first and only luggage at the airport, it’s only around 10kg.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""This is my last time""","","","Sarva Nari","(India)","19th November 2017","✅ Trip Verified | Ranchi to Kolkata. This is my last time.","Trip Verified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""paid double the fare""","","","D Huang","(Singapore)","17th November 2017","✅ Verified Review | Singapore to Bali. First and last time traveling with this airline. We paid double the fare to board ourselves to a later flight in the day due to arriving late at airport. The check-in staff assured us to board us onto the next flight. The price difference is nothing short of predatory pricing. AirAsia insists on an all-in tix plus luggage overweight charges, airport taxes and everything else. Fine, we did as per their recommendation and waited 2 hours to the ""next flight"". But the airline delays an extra 2 hours (this is only a 2 hours flight) and our first day of the vacation is almost over. Do yourself a favor and book Tiger/Scoot next time.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""second worst flight experience""","","","P Hearen","(United States)","17th November 2017","✅ Verified Review | Penang to Bangkok via Medan with Air Asia Indonesia. This was my second worst flight experience ever. It is absurd that they do not offer Fly Thru service for International flight connections. It is absurd how small the pitch is between seats. It is absurd they will fill up an A320, with no one in the exit rows because that costs extra, and kick a passenger who relocated there during the flight, how many advertisements are in the plane and that after collecting our baggage and passing through customs, simply to catch a connecting flight, the Checkin Agent insisted I pay cash for an outrageous overweight bag fee because he didn't feel like entering my credit card information into the computer. This is 2017, I can pay anyone for lunch with Venmo, but paying a major airline for a fee is difficult? Are you kidding me? It is absurd they woke me up to hand me a meal which I did not order, only to realize that the meal was for someone else, so they took the meal away. Wifi on plane? Advertised but doesn't work. Seat entertainment? Not on any planes. T","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""lowered my expectation""","","","T Paletta","(Thailand)","14th November 2017","✅ Verified Review | Shantou to Bangkok. With my knowledge having boarded AirAsia I simply lowered my expectation of inflight service to zero. Beautiful flight attendants were there greeting me. The plane took off as scheduled. The meal plan I pre-booked is served at a comfortable pace. They were using 2 flight attendants, one is to do everything and another is just to stand there and hand out the food. I have no idea whether it is the best way of serving on board but I see many flight attendants who are serving passengers more actively. They refused my Chinese money once I ordered a can of coke. I have given them 14RMB, the flight attendant returned me with 2RMB and said it is too old. As a passenger I can't the control or reject the legal money given to me from a supermarket, can I? Can they refuse legal bank notes?","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","""this trip was excellent""","","","David Robson","(United States)","14th November 2017","✅ Verified Review | I flew on Air Asia from Kuala Lumpur to Langkawi on November 9th 2017. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""prefer a regular airline""","","","J Harman","(Netherlands)","11th November 2017","✅ Verified Review | Bali to Phnom Penh via Kuala Lumpur with AirAsia. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""no priority seating""","","","Michael Czincila","(Thailand)","1st November 2017","✅ Verified Review | My wife and I just returned from a trip to the Maldives on flights FD 177 and FD 178 (Bangkok – Male) on 26 Oct and 31 Oct and I must say they were the worst flights we have ever experienced. We paid extra for the Premium Flex package. To start things off, we thought the flight would depart from the International terminal at Don Muang airport. The only thing departing there was the long bus ride from the far northern end of the airport to the extreme southern end where the plane was parked. A few meters more and we would have boarded from Ram Intra Rd. The plane then taxied back to the far north for take-off. Why couldn’t a concourse gate be used? While inflight we expected to get our pre-ordered meals which were ordered when the flights were booked in April. No way. Instead we were given a bland rice dish instead with no explanation as to why and a small bottle of water. On arrival in Male our express handling of baggage was anything but. I counted nearly 40 bags of normal baggage before our luggage appeared on the belt. So much for “express handling”. The departure from Male on 178 was delayed by the late arrival of 177 from BKK. Why a turnaround flight originating in BKK should be late (first and only flight) is beyond comprehension unless it was mechanical, but then no explanation for the delay was ever given to the passengers. It finally departed for BKK 1 ½ hours late (14.05 vs 12.35). In addition, there was no priority seating except that we were able to get on the bus first followed by remaining passengers on the flight until the bus was full. And again we were given the same rice dish we got on the outbound flight. This time we argued with the attendants about failure to provide what was ordered. One of them had the guts to tell us that ""This is what you ordered"". I told her it was not what we ordered and that Air Asia thinks it can serve premium customers whatever it (Air Asia) wants. Cash customers got what they ordered. We refused to eat that rice and my wife had to pay to get a drink and a candy bar to eat and drink. My wife overheard 2 attendants saying that at least 10 pre-ordered meals were not provided to people on that flight. Arrival in BKK again put us in a closed down section of the airport (old domestic terminal parking bays) and again bussed to the northern end of the airport. Again, no priority – everyone (136 passengers) were crammed into one bus at the top the terminal. So I ask you, would you put up with this type of service when paying premium fares for so-called better service?","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""not a single flight on time""","","","Mohammed Jadallah","(Saudi Arabia)","1st November 2017","✅ Verified Review | I flew with AirAsia 6 timea this past 2 weeks, not a single flight was on time. There was zero courtesy shown by staff to the peaple they are delaying. The airline showed zero responsibility towards people with connecting flights on the same airline or other airlines. I hated every minute with them. All this while forgetting it was not really a budget choice nor was there any added value for the cost.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""no compassion, no fairness, nothing""","","","W Morris","(Australia)","29th October 2017","✅ Verified Review | Flew Chiang Mai to Kuala Lumpur. AirAsia are cheap, but that's all they have going for them. The experience I have with them is as follows: Deceptive - they add lots of charges and it's hard to navigate their online system to avoid the extra fees. Website crashes - as said above, their site is 'tricky' to navigate. I think it's deliberate, to trick you into buying extras you don't want and to gain revenue from inadvertent double bookings of flights. Customer service - there is none of this at AirAsia. None. Ziltch. I asked for help and they arrogantly didn't listen, instead just threw 'policy' or 'rules' at me. There is no compassion, no fairness, nothing. Just everything their way. They won't even provide an escalation process if unhappy with their ruling. Unfair and unjust. Small seating - the seats are too small for taller people. I hate that. I will never book an Air Asia ticket again. Instead, I'll go Scoot or Jetstar - these companies have a heart and actually care about service.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""service is non-existent""","","","T Lee","(Australia)","27th October 2017","✅ Verified Review | AirAsia needs to step up its game! Flying from Penang to Kuala Lumpur so many times and most of the time the flight is always delayed by an hour plus. Same thing happened again this time, another delay by an hour plus. This is a joke, I have other flight to catch and life to live. The ticket price gets more expensive but service is non-existent. You are being hauled and hushed quickly by the staff and the prided best customer service is a joke. Not consistent and hard to get. Overprice F&B, seat selection and old entertainment and uncomfortable seating arrangement. I will go with a full service carrier in the future!","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","""friendly and very helpful""","","","L Thomas","(Malaysia)","25th October 2017","✅ Verified Review | I flew from Kalibo heading to Kuala Lumpur via AK609 on 14.25pm - 24 Oct 2017. Before boarding, I caught a fever. I asked for panadol from the crew and they were very responsive providing me with the medicine together with hot water. I had pre-ordered the in-flight meal of coconut rice and they were very kind to offer to help me change to a sandwich in order for me to eat the sandwich before taking the medicine. They came around offering me hot water from time to time. In conclusion, we really enjoyed the personalized service and value for money despite this being a budget airline. The cabin crew were friendly and very helpful.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""non-existent customer service""","","","Sachin B hatia","(India)","14th October 2017","✅ Verified Review | Among the worse airline in all respects. Terrible website, non-existent customer service, indifferent staff, horrible oily food and constant delays on most domestic and regional flights. And it has been getting worse with each passing year. Hardly remember a domestic flight in Malaysia which departed or reached on time.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""Bad customer service""","","","Cynthia Iskandar","(Australia)","14th October 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kansai to Kuala Lumpur. During my trip to Japan, I got news that my dad who lived in Indonesia suddenly got sick, he passed away few days later. I needed to leave Japan quicker than planned. Contacted AirAsia and they didn’t have any availability anymore on the day, but promised to give credit or somekind of proportioned refund for the original ticket, so long I provided all the documents requested. Which I did, I sent all the hospital letter and death certificate. Now 2 months later and still no response from the airline, I tried to contact the by email a few times already. Bad customer service.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""stop wasting passengers time""","","","S Ramesh","(India)","11th October 2017","✅ Verified Review | Air Asia 11.35 flight from Bangalore to Delhi is delayed for the second consecutive time we have used them. Fed up with this airline, would be better changing the flight time to stop wasting passengers time.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"6","""promised that it will be refunded""","","","D Lamon","(Philippines)","29th September 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Thiruchillapali. This is the first time I have experienced bad service by air Asia, and it happened in their KL terminal 2. My wife booked a ticket for me to go to India via KL, but she booked it under my nick name because domestically in the Philippines I travel under that name. The ticket we bought however does allow passenger name change, but there is a fine print which is a total con. The chat service and customer support just kept throwing us back and forth and finally when we pushed they promised that it will be refunded we just have to buy another ticket for the moment. Well this happened December 2016. Till now no answer, just a template answer saying no refund because the name is different. To me, I don't care about the money it's a small issue. I still fly air Asia when there is no other airline available for the price and time, but if there is a better airline, I take that instead.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"4","""always gave me a good journey""","1 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","P Wang","(Malaysia)","28th September 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Kuching.
