http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""staff were a little cold""","4 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Mayank Jalan","(India)","25th September 2017","✅ Verified Review | AirAsia charges its passengers for practically everything that it possibly can. Did web check-in 14 days prior but could not select seat of my wish free of charge. Was alloted a seat by the system randomly. The ground service at Bhubaneswar airport was pathetic with the airline staff not clear about the transit rules. There was no line at check-in counter and people were literally crowding at the counters to get their check-in done. flight departed 15 mins late but arrived on schedule. The staff were a little cold on this flight. Did not have any issue with seat pitch (my height is 164cms). The pilot made periodic announcements regarding flight progress which was nice. Had pre-ordered kabali biryani which was served with coke. Quantity of the meal was fine.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""sorry we are not responsible""","","","N Larins","(Netherlands)","20th September 2017","✅ Verified Review | I bought a ticket Padang - Kuala Lumpur in february 2017 for a flight in August. With this flight we had 6 hours in Kuala Lumpur to catch the other flight. After a month I a got a message of a reschedule for about two hours later. It still should be enough for the transfer in Kuala Lumpur. On the day of departure when we arrived at the ariport a next reschedule of the flight. This means about two hours for transer. This is very tight for a transer in Kuala Lumpur, due to the two different terminals. We informed the AirAsia staff, they arranged a Priority luggage handling. The man took a picture of our passport and ticket and send it to Kuala Lumpur to inform the office there and probably inform the Oman Air counter, our connecting carrier. Finally, at the gate we waited for three hours to found out that the flight was delayd for almost an hour! The plane had a fast and smooth trip to Kuala Lumpur. At arrival we ran to the luggage band, picked up our luggage as first and run to the next terminal. At the second terminal we found out that the connecting flight of Oman-Air has left already. The result was that I had to buy 4 new tickets to Amsterdam. Back home filling in the e-form and ask for help or compensation. But the only response of Air Asia, sorry we are not responsible. We can not be charged for costs due to delay or rescheduling. This means that you cannot trust AirAsia if you have a connecting flight. If you cannot trust the schedule you better don't fly with AirAsia. Im sorry because the flight and onboard service is okay. The lesson is that a cheap ticket can turn to be very expensive.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""please make sure it's consistent""","","","I Hui","(Hong Kong)","19th September 2017","✅ Verified Review | I was travelling from Bali to Hong Kong, where I had to transfer at KL. I only had a cabin size suitcase, and a drawstring backpack with me. I have been travelling with AirAsia many times in the past, due to the it's competitive price, even though the seats are uncomfortable, but I don't mind it for short hauls. I have always been using the same cabin size suitcase when travelling with them. So size wise, I know my suitcase is definitely fine. For my drawstring backpack, anyone who has one knows you can't really put much in it. I only had my personal documents in the bag, plus a jacket to use while on the flight. After I finished checking in, a guy stopped me and wanted to weigh my luggage. The total weight of my 2 pieces were just slightly over 10kg (the total permitted weight is 7kg for AirAsia). This is exactly what I came with, perhaps less. I threw away an old top and flip flops after this trip too. They weighed my luggage on my outward flights, I can't remember the total weight for that, but they let me through, but gave me a little advice to make sure I was within limit the next time. However, on my return flight, this guy did not let me through, he took my boarding pass away, even when I told him I was running late, I only had less than 10min left before boarding time! He said I had to check in my suitcase. So I had to quickly rearrange things in my suitcase again! After all this messing around, my suitcase was finally ready for checking it, and I was charged IDR 800k for that! My flight was only IDR 1,380,400! I could have pay a little bit more, and flew with Cathay, which comes with 20kg check-in luggage, a much comfier journey with entertainment, plus direct flight. What really annoyed me was that after I went to the other side at the boarding gate, I saw so many people with over-sized luggage. I spoke to 2 staff there to make a complaint, but they ignored me. As soon as I landed, I sent an email to AirAsia to make this complaint, there were a lot of emails back and forth, but they were not willing to do anything about it. I'm fine if they want to follow their rules strictly, but please make sure it's consistent.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Bali to Hong Kong via KL

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""flight departed on time""","","","Shaharuddin Mohd Sham","(Malaysia)","13th September 2017","✅ Verified Review | This was AirAsia, AK356, an afternoon flight from Kuala Lumpur to Surakarta. The flight departed on time and arrived at Adi Soemarmo International Airport 20 mins ahead of schedule. The flight generally was in fine weather, except for a bit of turbulence during descend into SOC. Landing was good.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""generally a good flight""","","","Shaharuddin Mohd Sham","(Malaysia)","13th September 2017","✅ Verified Review | This was flight AK329 from Semarang to Kuala Lumpur, a morning flight which departed 10 mins behind schedule. The captain made a flight-related announcement after attaining cruising altitude. It was generally a good flight in fine weather. The plane arrived in KUL as scheduled and landing was okay.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""no official communication""","","","Helene Margaret Hartwig","(Malaysia)","9th September 2017","✅ Verified Review | Our booking from Kuala Lumpur to Kota Kinabalu was for 17h30, got email that delay until 19.30. Checked in 16.30 and went to departure area. By 19h00 notification of another 1hr delay. 20h45 no official communication but flight staff member informed us that entire flight crew for our flight had been rerouted to another flight. All AirAsia staff disappeared and at 21h00 an announcement over public address system informed us that flight was delayed until 02h40. At customer service cubical in departues there was one AirAsia person with a queue of at least 50 customers waiting to be served. We then went home, no point staying in KK for 30 hrs as our return flight was at 15h00 on Sunday","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG-20170909-WA0000-50x50.jpg","","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG-20170909-WA0000-500x500.jpg","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG-20170909-WA0000-500x500.jpg","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""Customer Service is non-existent""","","","Prasad Paruchuri","(India)","27th August 2017","✅ Verified Review | One of our passengers wanted to upgrade to the Emergency Upgrade Seats. For two days before the actual travel date we could neither reach the AirAsia listed telephone no, nor could we re-login. After boarding the flight we saw a vacant seat and offered to pay but we were not allowed. Same thing happened on the way back from Bali. Neither the online check-in works nor the telephone no. Customer Service is non-existent. There is no AirAsia counter in KL Airport for the service of en route passengers. Even water is not served, which is being too stingy. The A320s flying to India are too cramped. On the way back from Bali to KL, we were unfortunate to get the last row seats. besides the constant sound of the toilet flush, the Cabin Crew, who did not have much work, were chatting away at the top of their voices like excited school children. Flights were late by minimum 1 hour on all four legs. Overall one of the lousiest flights that we have travelled. No professionalism at all.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft
Hyderabad to Denpasar via Kaula Lumpur

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""received very poor attention""","","","C Malinez","(Spain)","27th August 2017","✅ Verified Review | Hong Kong to Male via Kuala Lumpur. Horrible experience with AirAsia. We suffered a delay of 2 hours so we lost the conexion flight and after long time and queues we were re-scheduled 24 hours later. We were provided a horrible hotel voucher and received very poor attention.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Hong Kong to Male via Kuala Lumpur

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"6","""The flight went well""","","","S Hamaruddin","(Malaysia)","25th August 2017","✅ Verified Review | Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. The flight departed late, I had to wait about an hour. There was a technical difficulty, it seemed. The announcement about the delayed departure was made at the airport about 30 minutes before departure, and through email, which surprised me since the email was received shortly before the originally scheduled flight should have left. The flight went well.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"6","""I would recommend AirAsia""","","","M Ramatran","(Indonesia)","20th August 2017","✅ Verified Review | Bandung to Kuala Lumpur. The check in was fair, but I asked to pay the baggage fee - I didn't know that the ticket fare I bought online was not covering baggage. The airport boarding room in Bandung was not too big, some passengers were standing. The flight delayed for 30 minutes. The ground staff didn't arrange the queue according to the seat area, so people started to queque 30 minutes before call. I was not aware about pre meal order and decided not to order on board. The seat space was enough for me, maybe near emergency exit was wider. For low cost flight, I think I would recommend AirAsia.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""worst airline experience I've ever had""","","","Jessica Thornton","(United States)","10th August 2017","✅ Verified Review | AirAsia is by far the worst airline experience I've ever had. I had four AirAsia flights in the last week for my trip to Malaysia (Kuala Lumpur and Penang and back to Changsha) three of which were delayed. The ticketing process is set up to be easier but many of the automatic machines were not working and we had to ask several staff members for help before we could print tickets. On the first 2 flights, the staff were unfriendly. On the last flight the staff were friendly but seemed exasperated by all of the requests of passengers. Carry on bags should be only 7 kilos but only one airport weighed our bags and made us repack them. There is no unity among the airline. Every airport has a different request. AirAsia is cheap because they offer you no amenities included in the price. Checked bags, food, and drinks are all an extra cost. Passengers may order food and drinks and pay cash on the plane but it was not an organized system. People were crowding the aisles and shouting at the crew to get what they wanted. The chairs are quite uncomfortable, when it was time for landing, I didn't even realize my seat was reclined. Many of the passengers used their cell phones at inappropriate times which made me very uncomfortable. I would rather pay for a more expensive flight than take AirAsia again.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""They offer cheap flights""","","","Jade Stein","(Canada)","9th August 2017","✅ Verified Review | Hanoi to Bangkok. They offer cheap flights, but tack on a bunch of other costs. I tried to get the website to allow me to select baggage but it did not work. When I tried to call the phone number they provide for the Vietnam office, it did not go through. As a result, I was charged 40USD to check a 15kg bag. The staff was rude and unaccommodating. This may just be a problem with Air Asia in Hanoi. Aside from the booking process. They do not provide free water (let alone snacks) on flights as a low-cost airline.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""rather use other airline""","","","D Hamandra","(Indonesia)","5th August 2017","✅ Verified Review | Cengkareng to Denpasar. I am quite dissapointed with the service of Air Asia, they are not punctual with the schedule. Although they are cheap, they gave us poor service. On 7th July passengers were asked to proceed to the plane by bus. However, we were asked to stay in the bus for 30 minutes and asked to go back to the waiting room until further notice. Today, 4th August, using the same route, I experienced delay for my 21.00 flight. I just want to assure that cheap flights cannot degrade its service and punctuality, because, next time, I will rather use other airline (even more expensive one) in order to fly on time.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"9","""seats were very comfortable""","","","B Rennie","(Australia)","25th July 2017","✅ Verified Review | Penang to Langkawi. s overall a good experience, Check in was a little confusing as you have to label your own bags. There was a staff member on hand to assist if needed though. The line was a bit long and slow, Boarding was so organised, everyone had a line to be in which was according to seat number, very efficient, The plane seemed new, the seats were very comfortable, it was a very short flight yet it was surprising sine had ordered food however it wasn't served due to turbulence which was a surprise as we felt none, It was a nice flight and now I am seriously considering Air Asia for future flights - it was much nicer than the Malaysia Airlines domestic flights,","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""Check-in line management was extremely slow""","","","F Harrison","(United States)","23rd July 2017","✅ Verified Review | Check-in line management was extremely slow, that it took over an hour and 10 minutes to get to the counter. There was an unintelligible announcement that was later claimed by the airline as last minute check-in announcement. I was denied check-in more than 45 minutes before the flight time, when the boarding pass clearly said that the gate closes 30 minutes before departure time, for a delay caused by the airline's poor line management. I was not offered the option to pay a chhange fee. Instead, I had to pay the price difference for a same day flight, which was between as much as I had paid for the whole trip, up to double that. This has been the worst customer service I have received from any airline, anywhere, and I travel a lot. Will never fly this airline again, nor recommend it.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""very good value for money""","","","P Meerer","(Malaysia)","17th July 2017","✅ Verified Review | Yogyakarta to Kuala Lumpur. Flight departed on time and touched down Kuala Lumpur 20 minutes ahead of schedule. Cabin was very clean despite the rather short turn-around of 20 or so minutes. Announcements of cockpit and cabin crew were professional yet cheerful, providing the updates one would expect to feel welcome, comfortable and safe on board. As with most of AirAsia flights: very good value for money and overall good level of service in the air and on the ground.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"4","""male attendants were nice""","","","Dalia Dessouky","(Malaysia)","10th July 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Malé return. My very first flight AK 72 was considerably okay but the return was terrible. Both female flight attendants were rude, discourteous when they served the food. One of them nudged me hard to fasten my seatbelt in the middle of the flight due to turbulence. No please or excuse me, just a rough nudge. The male attendants were nice and were trying to do a good job.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""overall it is quite good""","2 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Oliver Oswin","(Indonesia)","2nd July 2017","✅ Verified Review | Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. Some of the crew is not so friendly but overall it is quite good.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/P_20170621_130401-1-50x50.jpg

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""not collaborating and unfriendly""","","","T Galleron","(France)","18th June 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Krabi. We booked our flights online, and our reservation was changed by Airasia without notice. They changed the time of the flights, changed the bagages allowances, etc. That caused a big problem at Male airport in Maldives where the staff was especially not collaborating and unfriendly. We have big the victimes of their unfair online system as still had to pay the price for this. Booking on Airasia is like playing russian roulette. I started my trip at Krabi airport where my 22 kg bag was accepted as a 20 kg check in bag. Then the same bag wasn't accepted in Kuala Lumpur and I have to waste 10 minutes and make the queue even worst to take out things from my bag. On the way back from the trip, same problem at the Cebu airport. You can take 25 kg ++ carry on bags without paying a check in bag while people like me who try to respect the check in system are just treated rudely for 2 kg in excess.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""nothing special about this airline""","1 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","M Slater","(Malaysia)","10th June 2017","✅ Verified Review | This is my return flight from Labuan to Kuala Lumpur. They will count and weigh every piece of bag. Nothing special about this airline.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"2","""small extra bag was sent away""","","","M Peck","(Malaysia)","31st May 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Labuan. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""Worst budget airline flights""","","","C Hanner","(Singapore)","26th May 2017","✅ Verified Review | Singapore to Kuala lumpur. http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""highly recommended for anyone""","3 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","George Adler","(Hungary)","16th May 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kota Kinabalu to Kuala Lumpur. Malaysia's well-known low-cost airline with technically unbeatable fares, which is really like a local bus service. My flight was smooth, check-in for domestic flights is also possible at self check-in kiosks, so it saved a lot of time. Seats were a bit tightly packed and if you didn't order meal or not planning to buy duty-free stuff, there is no contact between you and the crew. Basic flight experience, but highly recommended for anyone, who does not require sumptuous conditions for travel.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""meals were very good""","","","Y Manudra","(Indonesia)","16th May 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Phuket return with AirAsia . Mobile check in system was very easy, and I can reprint my boarding pass at the airport by my self. Flights were departed on time for both sectors. Pre booked meals were very good and cheaper than when you ordered on board with a free coke as a compliment. Cabin crews worked in the way that they were supposed to do.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""more than 1h 30mins delay""","","","Frederic Dumoulin","(Singapore)","3rd May 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. How come Air Asia could have won an award for best low cost airline? Took 4 Air Asia flights across the weekend, none were on time. Now, my last flight to come back to Singapore is announced on last minute with more than 1h 30mins delay, supposing a technical issue. Staff disappeared and screen even not updated. This is a poor experience and the lower one I have experienced in Asia. Does it worth to waste time and money when again in theory you caught a good ticket fare.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""bought through online booking service""","","","D Hacker","(Australia)","27th April 2017","✅ Verified Review | Ho Chi Minh City to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur with AirAsia. I have to say this was the worst travel experience I have had. We bought our fares through an online booking service rather than the airline. On the way there it was bought as one package i.e. one flight to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur then connecting flight to Ho Chi Minh City and we also bought a package of 2 flights for the way back the exact same way online. When arriving at Sydney no problem for the airline staff to print us both boarding passes for the Kuala Lumpur flight and also the Ho Chi Minh City flight at the same time. On the way back different story. They said that these were two separate flight bookings that our online booking service had made for us. So in KL we then had to go through all their security and customs and then check our bags again and this took us about 1.5 hours. Many times I have brought my own decaf coffee with me on the plane as airlines never serve decaf coffee and I don't drink caffeine. I usually just ask them if I can have a cup of boiling water with some milk and I add my own decaf coffee. I got told by a very nice air hostess that she would give me the hot water and milk (powdered) for free and that if I asked on another flight for this that I might be told to pay for a drink. There is no in flight entertainment and meals are not free as a low-cost airline. When you pay for a meal on the plane you must pay in Malaysian currency or credit card. Then if you don't have credit card you can't purchase anything. Fortunately I had some US dollars in cash and they made a quick conversion and I paid in that for my items.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Ho Chi Minh City to Sydney via KL

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""Both times were delayed""","","","P Kataris","(United States)","25th April 2017","✅ Verified Review | Flew with AirAsia from Denpasar Bali to Yogyakarta and back. Both times were delayed, one by 2hrs one by 35mins and I did not receive any notification of this delay. I guess lesson learned, you get what you pay for. At least let me know when my flight is going to be delayed, never flying them again.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""it'd be a good choice""","","","D Matryevo","(Russian Federation)","20th April 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Bangkok. There are so many check-in counters in KL airport that it was not easy to find the right one and then it took about 50 minutes in the queue. The flight was delayed for about 1 hours. As bought value pack I was given a small bottle of water and small sandwich. In addition I bought a seat near exit row, so I felt comfortable and I think it worth the money paid. There was some inflight magazines in English. It's a low cost airline and it it's under 100$ it'd be a good choice.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

column1: http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""flight went well""","","","S Snyder","(Malaysia)","19th April 2017","✅ Verified Review | It was a morning flight from Kuala Lumpur to Padang with AirAsia. Landing was smooth.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""was efficiently conducted""","","","shaharuddin mohd sham","(Malaysia)","14th April 2017","✅ Verified Review | It was an early night flight from Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. The flight was nearly full, and boarding commenced early and was efficiently conducted. The plane was able to leave the terminal building early but because of numerous aircraft waiting to take-off, departure was behind schedule. The flight was smooth almost all the way except a few minor turbulence in mid-air. Take-off and landing was good.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/1/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""pass no longer guarantees an upgrade""","","","Chris Odell","(Australia)","8th April 2017","✅ Verified Review | I first bought the upgrade pass in 2015 via Air Asia site and I purchased 6 upgrades to business class for more than the amount if you go directly to optiontown and request a non guaranteed upgrade but I thought the guaranteed one was worth the extra money. I simply had to directly book a business class seat. Then in 2016 when my pass expired I again went on the AirAsia site and purchased another 6 upgrades. What they didn't state clearly is that the pass no longer guarantees an upgrade, in fact it is useless as you are required to book an economy seat and then go onto the optiontown site and request an upgrade. So you pay a higher price and you have almost no chance of getting an upgrade. This is because Air Asia has already sold a huge number of these passes and has already obtained that money. So then if any business class seats are left, they heavily discount them. So for my new upgrade pass I received no upgrades. I even went on line and saw that there was only 1 business class seat left on a flight and although I had the pass, I paid the heavily discounted extra price of $800 so I could receive the seat. I then made a complaint and was told the pass could be extended, but this was a 1 off for 3 months only, and sure enough I didn't receive an upgrade during this time. My advice is to not buy an upgrade pass but take your luck and just try as a one off on the optiontown site, whereby if you don't receive the upgrade they at least refund your money. On the pass they only give you useless 'credits' which you will never use in the limited time period.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""have lost all credibility""","4 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","R Jones","(Indonesia)","5th April 2017","✅ Verified Review | AirAsia offer four flights a day to Singapore from Bali Indonesia. Unfortunately it is difficult to rely on any flight time as they have started consolidating flights to fill planes. My booking for the earliest flight was to allow time to take my daughter to Singapore for her 21st birthday. First flight in, last flight out would give us 12 hours in singapore. 2 days before the flight to Singapore AirAsia resheduled it, ok fair enough, it was only by 2 hours. But then 6 hours before the flight they rescheduled it again by 3 hours. Then to add insult to injury the rescheduled flight was also delayed by 50 minutes. We finally got to Singapore but our entire whole day shopping trip turned into only 3 hours. Why offer such an extensive array of flights you have no intention to fulfil? AirAsia have lost all credibility","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""inflight service is rude""","","","C Shepherd","(United States)","3rd April 2017","✅ Verified Review | Surat Thani to Kuala Lumpur. AirAsia has to be one of the all around worst airlines I have ever flown. I don't write reviews, this is the first. I travel internationally a lot and am used to difficult situations and bad service. It takes a little effort to get me annoyed. Their website doesn't work very well. It constantly kicks you off. The website won't take any of my Visa cards. Because of this, I am forced to purchase tickets thru a 3rd party such as orbitz with the same cards where purchasing add ones such as baggage is not always an option. Some flights include a checked bag, others don't. So, if their website doesn't work and you can't pay in advance, you are left with getting ripped off at the airport on your bag fees. Inflight service is rude and narrow minded. For example, I booked meal service for a flight in February 2017 from Bangkok to Hanoi. I ordered a coffee in advance, however, after traveling all night, I decided to forgoe the coffee and sleep instead. I asked for a water and was told ""no, you must have coffee because it is what you ordered."" I said ""okay, I'll pay for the water"". Staff gave me an annoyed look and pushed the cart away. I was not rude, I was not demanding, but was treated very poorly. I ended up having to flag down another attendant and ask for a water. This was not an isolated incident. Similar things have happened to me before and I seen it happen to many others. Maybe my expectations are to blame here because of where I come from, but the capacity for abstract thought seems to be lacking within this organization. Being kind, courteous and compassionate is not a hard thing. Unfortunately, there is no recourse for me. They don't care. They are so big, it will be hard to avoid them in the future, but I'll will do my best to use other airlines.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""cabin crew was so attentive""","","","R Kadianto","(Indonesia)","27th March 2017","✅ Verified Review | A good flight from Surabaya to Johor Bahru return. No delay at all (arrive earlier). It is better to prebook food, but price onboard is still fair. The aircraft cabin is clean and the cabin crew was so attentive. I got separate seat from Johor to Surabaya, crew know about it and give me permission to change to my family in hot seat (front row). I really appreciate it.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"4","""good value for money""","3 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Jeffrie Trika","(Australia)","15th March 2017","✅ Verified Review | Jakarta to Ho Chi Minh City via Kuala Lumpur. We've been on Air Asia and its subsidiaries a few times, mostly enjoyable, no nonsense and good value for money, so was this flight. One unpleasant experience on this particular flights
column2: we were separated between KUL-SGN due to full flight - apparently and was advised to see ground staff at transfer desk KLIA2, where there was no help. We went to the boarding gate and they gave us 31B/31 C at the back of the plane. Once onboard, it wasn't a full flight, there are plenty of seats available. AirAsia system obviously cannot see that it was a single booking for two pax, hence they do not allocate seats for two.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

column1: Jakarta to Ho Chi Minh via Kuala Lumpur

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""arrival was on time""","","","S Shaw","(Malaysia)","9th March 2017","✅ Verified Review | This Bandung - Kuala Lumpur flight was a morning flight. It arrived in Husein Sastranegara Airport on time but departed 10 mins late. The plane encountered mild turbulence on the early and later part of the flight, but generally it was smooth. Landing was okay in KUL. Arrival was on time. This time I ordered the satay wrap, and it was succulent.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""flight was generally smooth""","","","S Shaw","(Malaysia)","9th March 2017","✅ Verified Review | This was a morning flight from Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta. The flight was nearly full and departure was not as scheduled, it was at most 10 mins. late. The flight was generally smooth, and landing was good. Even though we departed late, the plane arrived on time. This time, I didn't ordered any food as I remembered my bad experience with the food on my last flight.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""customer service is the worst""","","","S Davidson","(Malaysia)","16th February 2017","✅ Verified Review | Flew AirAsia from Phnom Penh to Kuala Lumpur. I have flown with Airasia for a year now and I travel often. Their customer service is the worst, its really hard to contact them. Online there is over an hour wait and there are always issues. AirAsia tries to charge for everything it can think of, even for making a payment. Cheap, but not worth all the trouble.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"9","""good value for money""","","","Adele Malcolm","(United Kingdom)","16th February 2017","❎ Unverified | Ho Chi Minh City to Penang. This was a very straightforward flight experience with an easy check, boarding, flight and landing. As it's a budget airline you don't expect any frills but the experience was fine all the way through. We'd paid extra so we got express boarding (more so we can be sure to get overhead luggage space beside our seats). No complaints at all. Good value for money.","Unverified","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Ho Chi Minh City to Penang

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""claimed I had only purchased one""","","","D Keale","(United States)","15th February 2017","✅ Verified Review | Seoul to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur. AirAsia has terrible customer service and tries to overcharge passengers at every turn. I purchased 2 25 kg checked bags, but at check in, they claimed I had only purchased one, which resulted in by baggage being 11 kg over the weight allowance that I purchased. They then offered to check the remainder of my luggage for 42,000 won per kg, or 1.5 times the cost of my original ticket. They wanted 640,000 won for my 11 kg of checked luggage which they falsely claimed that I had not purchased. I am never flying AirAsia again.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller
Seoul to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""would fly with AirAsia again""","","","H Hanaruddin","(Malaysia)","13th February 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Kuching. A really nice and comfortable flight. I've also noticed that AirAsia arrives earlier or on-time despite being delayed for half an hour. The cabin crew was really friendly. Thus this shuts all my negative views towards them before. I would fly with AirAsia again.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG_20170211_201513-50x50.jpg","","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG_20170211_201513-500x500.jpg","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG_20170211_201513-500x500.jpg","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"4","""plenty of decent looking food""","","","J Daniak","(Australia)","12th February 2017","✅ Verified Review | Bali to Perth with AirAsia Indonesia. It was my first time flying on AirAsia. Unfortunately I did not have a great experience. This is because throughout the entire flight two little kids kept grabbing the top of my seat like little monkeys. When they weren't dangling from my seat or my boyfriends seat they were kicking our seats, for 4+hours. The odd thing was that these kids did not seem to have a seat of their own, and were either sitting on their parents lap or torturing my boyfriend and I. I don't know that I can fault the airline for this, as we never voiced to the flight attendent what was going on. On a side note, I thought the airline provided plenty of decent looking food and beverage options.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""luggage not included in ticket price""","","","S Trachan","(Australia)","11th February 2017","✅ Verified Review | Siem Reap to Bali via Kuala Lumpur. The flight was fine and the staff were nice. We were unaware that checked luggage was not included in the ticket price and as a a result we had to pay 72USD each on the spot to have our bags put on the plane. This has never happened on other flights I've flown. How can they justify charging that much for a bag to be put on the plane? That cost is almost as much as the flight ticket! Be careful of this little money maker, if you don't check that little box when buying your ticket online you'll be paying through the teeth to bring your luggage.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""refund is still in progress""","","","Luke Beck","(Switzerland)","7th February 2017","✅ Verified Review | Hong Kong to Kota Kinabalu in October 2016. All flights were cancelled due to the supertyphoon, we got offered to get a refund of the flight. I filled in the form the same day, now like 3.5 months later my refund is still in progress. I got an email that I got my miles for that flight (I had to open one of those accounts at Air Asia just to check my refund status which is not nice as well), but the flights were cancelled. Bad customer service.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""4 months of delay""","","","L Param","(Panama)","5th February 2017","✅ Verified Review | Booked and paid for a flight on AirAsia a month before travelling. The night before our flight to Phuket (less than 8 hours) we were informed our flight was cancelled. We were offered a full refund, or rebook on another flight. We had a commitment in Phuket so chose the refund and purchased tickets on another airline. Sent everything for the refund. Nothing happened. Talked to their live chat Oct 21 and was told my refund was in process. It is now February 4 2017 and after waiting in a live chat queue for 62 minutes I was told they are dealing with massive requests and are sorry for the delay - 4 months of delay! They have no clue as to when I might expect a refund. They don't handle that. I asked for an email to send a complaint to and was given the e-form. Already had written them but no response.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""delicious food and drinks""","","","W Arthur","(Indonesia)","5th February 2017","✅ Verified Review | Yogyakarta to Denpasar with AirAsia. I used Web check in and boarding pass printing at home and no baggage (although for domestic always include 15 kg baggage). Direct to departures after security check. Good boarding process. Nice livery. I pre order 2 pax food (nasi lemak and chicken dijon) and get free 2 drink (hot coffee and still water). Total price only IDR 67 k (USD 5) for delicious food and drinks. I eat one portion in the flight and one in waiting next flight. I always love flying with Air Asia Indonesia because if the humble flights attendant. Although this is low cost carrier, they work professionally and friendly, like full service airlines. And this is always better than AK or D7. Delay in departure, on time in arrival. And I get high fare, because I see 25% lower price several days before flying. Overall okay and worth it.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG_20170121_140008_HDR-50x50.jpg

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"3","""receive the benefits they paid for""","3 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","B Baker","(United Kingdom)","3rd February 2017","✅ Verified Review | Flew AirAsia from Denpasar to Perth. Had booked Red Carpet to eliminate queues through security immigration and passport control, and it did work very well, including access to a very good lounge. The whole thing was ruined by imposition of a fingertip search of cabin baggage - 30 minutes in the queue. AirAsia - we approve the need for security measures, but you must provide those who have paid for red carpet to receive the benefits they paid for.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""why do AirAsia not allow minor changes""","3 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Sean Clarke","(Ireland)","31st January 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Langkawi in December 2016. I and my partner have always chosen to book with Air Asia as our preference for Asia. I booked and realised that I had the wrong date, it was the 22nd and not the 23rd. Okay, I should have seen this but I didn't. It may even have been the sites fault as I am so careful booking. I noticed this within seconds after the confirmation came in. I tried to call and after a wait of over 100 minutes, the call was answered. I was cut off by their agent. Infuriating and an absolute disgrace and contempt for their passenger. A wait of this length says it all about their attitude. Wait long enough so you hang up? The problem then goes away? I emailed 6 weeks ago and am still waiting for a reply. I had to book again and lose the first flight for both of us. Why do AirAsia not allow minor changes within a set time, say 12/24 hours? Not have a proper customer service centre that will call you back if wait times are over, say fifteen minutes or reply to your email? AirAsia has lost their shine for us.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""cabin staff were kind and helpful""","","","H Jackson","(Indonesia)","28th January 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Surabaya with AirAsia. The flight departed and arrived on time. The ground staff for check in were not very efficient as there were only some counters that open and the ground staff were quite slow to handle the passengers. The cabin staff were kind and helpful. The seat was standard of LCC. The nasi padang that me and my family bought was delicious. Overall, my experience with AirAsia was quite nice.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""cabin crew were attentive""","","","M Shamaruddin","(Malaysia)","26th January 2017","✅ Verified Review | A 7.50am flight from Kuala Lumpur to Makassar. Predeparture announcement was made by the Captain. Departed 15 mins late as heavy traffic at KLIA. The departure gate was right at the end, a real hassle to walk to. It was a smooth flight except about 45 mins before landing, where we encountered slight turbulence. Other than that, the cabin crew were attentive and took care of the passengers.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""everything went smoothly""","","","H Manuruddin","(Malaysia)","26th January 2017","✅ Verified Review | I took this flight from Makassar Sultan Hasanuddin Airportback to Kuala Lumpur. It was a late morning flight and it departed on time. The flight was nearly full but everything went smoothly, thanks mostly to the cabin crew expertly managing the passengers. I bought a prepaid gift online that was delivered during flight, as promised. The flight was more or less smooth along the way.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""Cheap flights .. seats are narrow ""","","","S Brettel","(Australia)","21st January 2017","✅ Verified Review | Singapore to Penang. Cheap flights but the seats are narrow and the pitch is not great for long distance flights. Only 29 inches pitch means you will struggle to sit comfortably if you are above average height. Front row (Row 1) seats and Exit Rows 12 and 14 have more leg room but no under seat storage in front of you and overhead lockers can be limited. If you book the front rows of seats (Rows 1 - 5, 12 & 14) at an extra cost you do get priority boarding so can manage to get luggage overhead. Service is good, on time departure if the flight arrives on time, you can book food at an extra cost but only a 1h 20m flight so not really needed.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"4","""left the lights on till 1am""","","","M Drenth","(Netherlands)","19th January 2017","✅ Verified Review | Flew Sydney to Yangon via Kuala Lumpur. OK, AirAsia is a budget airline, no trouble. Unless you have no money on you and no water, you are in trouble. Everything here has a price ticket, which was absolutely ridiculous on a 13 hour flight: since when do we have to pay for a human right (water). The leg space was so little, that my partner got cramps in his legs (he is nearly 2 meters) and even I (1.65m) was struggling being comfortable. Beside the lack of space, the staff were unfriendly, rude and didn't seem to be interested in their job at all. There was no onboard-entertainement and the check-in at Sydney Airport took nearly 2 hours. Yes, that is correct, we stood 2 hours in line to check in. Another reason why we would not choose AirAsia again is because of the fact that they left the lights on till 1am in the morning, while most people were trying to sleep. This broke us up, as we were so tired but couldn't sleep because of the lights. All in all, we wouldn't fly AirAsia anymore and strongly recommend to show up a few hours before your flight leaves, as the ground-staff were very slow. We had similair problems, a month later when we flew from Yangon to Bangkok: the airplane was a bit late and not cleaned at all. We were boarding the aircraft while the previous passangers hadn't even left the plane! Secondly, because of the lack of legspace, it will most likely be a very uncomfortable flight.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"6","""crew not that friendly""","","","William Lay","(Singapore)","14th January 2017","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. The check in was quite long and the ground staff not fast to handle. The flight initially was on time, but by the time we were onboard the aircraft, the pilots said that the air conditioner was not working and we need to wait for another 30 minutes. The flight in the end was delayed by around 1 hour. The cabin crews did not greet the passengers and involved in their own conversations. The food that I ordered was quite nice, which is nasi lemak. Overall, the flight was quite disappointing as the flight was delayed and the cabin crew not that friendly. It was worse than my previous AirAsia flights.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","""cabin crew was cheerful""","","","M Parsons","(Malaysia)","27th December 2016","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Lombok. Overall a good experience with the flight departing on time and touching down a few minutes ahead of schedule. As with most AirAsia flights, the cabin crew was cheerful and with a better service mind than many full service carriers. The pre-ordered meal was hot and tasty and served shortly after flight take-off. Cockpit announcements were professional and providing all the necessary information required to feel safe.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"6","""this is much appreciated ""","","","Min Siang Wong","(Malaysia)","22nd December 2016","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Kualanamu. I was late and almost missed out on the boarding time. Luckily one of the shopper staff help me contact the AirAsia staff to reopen the gate due to I miss out the gate time before 15 min departure. Fortunately, at the end a member of AirAsia reopen the P5 gate so we do not miss out the flight. Thank you and this is much appreciated for everyone's helping hand.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""Most ridiculous flight""","","","R Finch","(China)","20th December 2016","✅ Verified Review | Chengdu to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur. Most ridiculous flight I've ever experienced. Flying with two adults, an infant on lap and a two year old child. At airport early and possible to check baggage through to final destination, but couldn't print boarding cards or check in for second leg of flight. At transfer desk as soon as landed and five plus hours before second flight but still given three seats each several rows apart - including our two year old. Told that this was within policy since we had not paid extra to reserve seats together and there was nothing they could do but we could ask at the gate. Did that and told nothing they could do but should ask on board. On board told no, that was the policy and we couldn't change seats. Obviously not feasible to leave a two year old five rows away from nearest parent for a three hour flight, finally agreed could ask other passenger's if they'd mind swapping. Couldn't wait at front of plane or on bridge until everyone else had boarded though as that would delay boarding - he'd have to sit on his own until everyone else was in their seats and then we could try to swap if there was time before take off. In case you haven't met a two year old, getting him to sit next to strangers in a strange place with no parents in sight is unlikely to work and I imagine you'd probably get arrested for child cruelty in some countries. Eventually simply picked two random empty seats next to each other and pleaded with passengers to swap who thankfully took pity on us. Will not be flying Air Asia again, am amazed that their policy of two year olds sitting on their own is even legal.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","""will get what you pay""","1 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Z Mahawaz","(Malaysia)","16th December 2016","✅ Verified Review | Miri to Kuala Lumpur. I frequently used AirAsia since 2010 until now. You will get what you pay. You cannot expect first class service with the price of a few dollars. I very much like its Nasi Lemak. The ground service is good. For once, I accidently left my wallet under my seat. The flight already departed to another place. Luckily me, the staff found my wallet and keep it for me.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""no pre-departure announcement by the captain""","","","S Stevens","(Malaysia)","7th December 2016","✅ Verified Review | I took the KUL-SUB flight on 02 December 2016. We departed later than scheduled, 25 minutes to be exact. The flight was almost full. There was no pre-departure announcement by the captain. The seat that was bought by me was initially taken up by somebody else as the person wanted to sit in a group. The stewardess was able to settle the dispute amicably. The flight was smooth most of the time. Landing was okay.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""generally smooth all the way""","","","S Stevens","(Malaysia)","7th December 2016","✅ Verified Review | Surabaya Kuala Lumpur with AirAsia. It was a very early flight (5 am). The flight was nearly full as many groups of people performing Umrah were using this service en-route to Jeddah. This contributed to the delay of the flight departure to about 30 minutes. The first food service for pre-booked meals and second for in-flight food sales was done rather quickly but smoothly. The first officer made the pre-departure announcement while the captain made the mid-air announcement. The flight was generally smooth all the way. Landing was good.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""onboard crew were great as per usual""","","","Roddy MacDonald","(United Kingdom)","4th December 2016","✅ Verified Review | After being slightly annoyed that AirAsia rescheduled our departure time to an hour later, they got us to Kuala Lumpur and we made our connection in plenty time. Was made to wait in a massive que when I only had hand luggage to have my ""documents checked"" when I arrived at the desk I was told that I should of gone straight to security, I was far from impressed but the onboard crew were great as per usual!","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""the onboard staff were super""","","","Roddy MacDonald","(United Kingdom)","4th December 2016","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Singapore with AirAsia. A small problem at check in with the wrong seats printed on my boarding pass to what I had originally paid for, but that was easily resolved, the flight was very busy and the ground staff were not the best at dealing with boarding The onboard staff were super.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""flight was short and sweet""","","","Roddy MacDonald","(United Kingdom)","4th December 2016","✅ Verified Review | Phuket to Kuala Lumpur was my first flight with AirAsia. After 1 hour and 15 mins, we departed to Kuala Lumpur, flight was short and sweet!","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"8","""service of the staff is commendable""","","","Mingxiu Huang","(Singapore)","13th November 2016","✅ Verified Review | Flew on AK700 from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur. The flight was delayed due to the congestion at Changi Airport, but we arrived at Kuala Lumpur just on schedule. Refreshments were available for purchase at decent price on this short flight. I got a cup noodle for MYR8 which is around US$1.81. Flew on AK713 from Kuala Lumpur back to Singapore. We arrived Singapore 15 mins ahead of schedule. The service of the staff is commendable, and it would be perfect if the legroom can be bigger. Overall, I prefer AirAsia as my first choice to Kuala Lumpur, for its cheap price and reputation of world's best low cost carrier.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""flight was slightly delayed""","","","M Saunders","(Malaysia)","7th November 2016","✅ Verified Review | Return flight from Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta. The flight was slightly delayed, should have departed by 7 am as scheduled but departed at 7.34 am. There was mild turbulence during the early part of the flight but later the weather was fine all the way to Jakarta. All announcements (pre-departure, mid-air and before descend) were made by the captain. Landing was good.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""flight was generally pleasant""","","","M Saunders","(Malaysia)","7th November 2016","✅ Verified Review | Flew from Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. Boarding was fast, by 8.30 all passengers had boarded. There was no pre-departure announcement by the captain, only mid-air and before descent announcements were made. The 2nd service cart was very slow in the beginning. Flight was generally pleasant all the way. Landing was good. A new food container was used, and I found it easier to use and dispose of. For the first time (for me), the head cabin crew announced on the separation of rubbish between recyclables and non-recyclables, into white and green plastic bags. Congrats, AirAsia.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG_20161106_093155-50x50.jpg","","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG_20161106_093155-500x500.jpg","http://www.airlinequality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/IMG_20161106_093155-500x500.jpg","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","""exceeded my expectations on this trip""","4 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Michael Andersen","(United States)","29th October 2016","✅ Verified Review | AirAsia exceeded my expectations on this trip. Both flights were on-time. Boarding was fast and efficient. The aircraft was clean, modern and well-appointed. The flight crew were friendly with attractive uniforms. I had a reserved seat and had pre-booked a meal when I purchased my ticket, which was served to me at my seat. My connecting flight was easy to transfer to and there were no delays. This was my first experience with AirAsia and I will certainly use them again on my next trip to S.E. Asia.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""10 minutes between flights""","","","Alexandre Santos","(Portugal)","23rd October 2016","✅ Verified Review | I'm reviewing a booking, not an actual flight: I booked Denpasar - Manila on 15/11/2016, with a 2 hour transit at KL. Some days afterwards I received an e-mail from AirAsia saying the flight from Denpasar / KL was rescheduled leaving me 10 minutes between flights. There were 2 links: One for a telephone number which I called and whose lady said she couldn't help. Another for a chat that was consistently unavailable for 2 days. Also a e-form, which I used twice, but with no answer. The email itself couldn't be answered. After several tries on at least two days and two hours (in total) waiting, I managed to contact the live chat. I found out they would keep my money at least one month, if I'd cancel and ask for a refund. I had to search for alternative flights myself,on AirAsia website while chatting - they didn't help on any regard. In between, the chat was timed-out. So I had to wait again and managed to change the flight to the only option that allowed me to arrive on time at Manila. That forced me to stay overnight at KL. AirAsia didn't offer any compensation for that. I'm still waiting for the next e-ticket, and for the next chapter of this nightmare.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"9","""extremely helpful and kind""","","","Muhammad Khurram Suleman","(South Korea)","20th October 2016","✅ Verified Review | On my AirAsia trip from Kuala Lumpur to Busan my plane was delayed due to weather. I had to spend many hours in the airport but it was ok because of the excellent customer service provided by staff. She was extremely helpful and kind. I am very grateful to her for making my long delay much better.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""customer services refused to help""","","","S Johnson","(United Kingdom)","17th October 2016","✅ Verified Review | Bangkok to Krabi. Don't bother flying with AirAsia. Sent me a text saying they have changed my flight time. They didn't bother sending an email with any more details to resolve it. When I spoke to their customer services they refused to help - they have a policy that if they have changed the flight time to within 3 hours of the original time they won't offer a refund. Not great when you picked a specific flight time to suit you - i.e. after a tour has finished/leaving enough time to check into the hotel. Means I have to pay for another flight with another airline, I might as well have thrown my money in the bin.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"10","""great flight, great service""","","","C Clarke","(United Kingdom)","12th October 2016","✅ Verified Review | Bali to Bangkok with AirAsia. I don't normally use low cost airlines and this was only my fourth flight on a low cost and I fly at least 12 times each year. All previous flights where on AirAsia and only pretty short so I was a bit scepticle using them for this 4h+ flight. The direct options between Bali and Bangkok are limited to either Thai or AirAsia from what I can see, the AirAsia schedule suited me better so I choose the full package including luggage, Red Carpet Service, preferred seat, food and comfort kit. Check in was quick using the red carpet service which was also fully escorted from check in through security to the lounge. The lounge is old but so is the airport but fine to spend an hour with food and wifi. Boarding through gate 6a was done with priority and included a bus ride on my own as part of the red carpet service. Once onboard seat 1A was fine with enough space, not the most comfortable seat but okay. Crew where young but polite the food was also okay for airline food. Take off right on time with a flight time a little longer at 4h20m so landed a little late. Bags took a little time to arrive once off the flight at DMK. Otherwise a great flight and great service from the ground crew at DPS all for less than £100 which was half the cost of the nearest indirect option with the other direct option costing 3 times more.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"9","""seats were comfortable""","3 reviews","http://www.airlinequality.com/reviewer/reviewer-signup","Paolo Guidali","(Italy)","28th September 2016","✅ Verified Review | Bangkok to Siem Reap return. We chose AirAsia because it was the cheapest option and we were very satisfied. On the return flight we had a connection and we had to change airport and discovered it was very easy. Seats were comfortable, flights were both on time, everything was ok. We shipped one laggage and everything was fine.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""good flight for this route""","","","S Hee","(Australia)","28th September 2016","✅ Verified Review | Siem Reap to Kuala Lumpur. The only flight that would suit me on my date of travel. AirAsia had great check in crew and answered all my queries promptly with professionalism. Boarding was swift abeilt the slight delay. The interior of the cabin looked tired and perhaps a big of a facelift. Seats were showing signs of replacement required. Other than that, all went well. Good flight for this route.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"6","""okay flight for this route""","","","S Hee","(Australia)","28th September 2016","✅ Verified Review | A short shuttle flight between Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. On board everything seemed good but the interior does need a bit of a facelift. Boarding was chaotic due to delays. An okay flight for this route, I would choose a different airline if it wasnt for it's price.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""choosing to ignore AirAsia""","","","Rainer Grumann","(Malaysia)","27th September 2016","✅ Verified Review | Kuala Lumpur to Yangon. AirAsia is an ok airline when everything is going smooth. If a problem is occurring, they are unable to attend to customers. I made a booking for a flight and because the credit card interface did not work, I allowed them to debit my bank account for a ticket. The booking number is even mentioned in the bank account statement but they never sent a ticket. As I had to fly for business trip, I was booking the same flight on the same date again and paid with credit card (this time, it worked). The customer is providing proof of double payment on the same day, is even giving the booking number of the flight where he did not receive a ticket and providing all information needed for a refund. AirAsia is choosing to ignore me. I tried as well on the counter at the airport in KL, they can't do anything. Therefore, I am now choosing to ignore AirAsia - it's a matter of principle.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"4","""disappointed with their punctuality""","","","Candra Widjaja","(Indonesia)","26th September 2016","✅ Verified Review | I have been using AirAsia since around 2010. I previously had no major problem. However, this time I felt really disappointed with their punctuality. The round trip Jakarta to Singapore, each trip was delayed 45 min to 1 hour. In addition of that, before take off and landing, the crew told the passengers that due to traffic on the airport, the aircraft had to wait for another 15 to 30 min. For me, that just could not be more annoying. AirAsia is no longer a budget flight. The price has gone up tremendously. It is often more expensive than Batik Air, the premium brand of the Lion Air group. Unlike Lion, I hardly heard anyone complaining about Batik problems such as delays. With competitors now offering better options and coming up with new promotions, I think AirAsia may start losing its grip. Check-in now has to be self-service and the early passengers can't choose their seats. It is now randomly assigned. Distance between rows is really narrow.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Type Of Traveller

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"1","""delayed due to technical problems""","","","Garry Fairman","(Australia)","25th September 2016","✅ Verified Review | Flight from Denpasar to Perth was delayed due to technical problems resulting in boarding about an hour late. The plane is pushed back for take off and then returns to stand with captain saying there are technical issues. We get off back into terminal and wait for +2 hours before reboarding plane. Whilst in terminal no offer of water or food - in fact passengers that bought water were told they were unable to take back with them onto aircraft. If you wanted water you had to buy. Eventually take off and get to Perth before landing and then waiting for further 30 minutes in aircraft with engines running as ""no ground crew to assist"" and lighting in plane left off so we disembark in the dark. Total of 11 hours for return trip to Perth and ruined what was a great first time trip to Bali. Have never used a budget airline before and will not be doing again. Indonesia AirAsia do not look after customers when there are problems.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""cabin staff were attentive""","","","S Allam","(Malaysia)","19th September 2016","✅ Verified Review | Yogyakarta to Kulua Lumpur with AirAsia. There was no pre-departure announcement made by the captain. The flight departed as scheduled and arrived 20 mins ahead of schedule. Flight was smooth except for slight turbulence a few minutes prior to descent. The captain gave 2 announcements, one while cruising and one before descent. Flight was nearly full. Cabin was clean and cabin staff were attentive to passengers' needs. The aircond was working well.","Verified Review","http://www.airlinequality.com/verified-reviews/","","","","","","Aircraft

http://www.airlinequality.com/airline-reviews/airasia/page/2/?sortby=post_date%3ADesc&pagesize=100,"7","""cabin was clean, aircon was cold""","","","S Allam","(Malaysia)","19th September 2016","✅ Verified Review | Kulua Lumpur to Yogyakarta with AirAsia.
